chargeHist.descr: Manf/Del Clonazepam (2nd or subsequent, near a school)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Melissa S. SCHROEDER was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Deliver Schedule IV Drugs (Clonazepam), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(i).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to the prison sentence presently being served, to commence upon defendant's discharge date after extended supervision ends.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full-time employment or work search.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Defendant is to use only doctor to prescribe medications and only one pharmacist to dispense medications unless approved by the agent.
AODA assessment and follow through counseling.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody on warrant and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail. The matter is continued for initial appearance on 01-04-2016 at 2:30 p.m., Br. 1.  Bail is set at $3,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that she have no contact with any known illicit drug users or distributers, and she must maintain absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol, with the exception of prescriptions in prescribed doses.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Warrant returned with service of officer thereon.
